title: Sunak Defends Rwanda Plan At PMQS As Starmer Goes On The Offensive Ahead Of Crucial Vote
description: Two deputy chairmen of the Conservatives resigned from their roles as they joined dozens of Tory right-wingers in backing amendments to toughen the scheme.

title: DAILY MAIL COMMENT: At 11th hour, Tories see sense on Rwanda
description: After a nail-biting day of cajoling, reassuring, phone-calling, arm-twisting and - let's not be coy - threats by the whips, Tory MPs backed Rishi Sunak's flagship Rwanda migrant plan.

title: How Rishi Sunak beat the Tory right with Priti Patel's deal, Starmer's PMQs and MP 'wimps'
description: ANALYSIS: Rishi Sunak has won a major victory and defeated the right of his party meaning he now will almost certainly lead the Tories into the next election.

title: Sir Tony Lloyd, Labour MP for Rochdale, dies at 73
description: Sir Keir Starmer, the Labour leader, said that Lloyd’s death was a “terrible loss”, writing on Twitter/X: “We will remember his deep commitment to Labour values and his decency.”

title: Sunak survives as Rwanda rebellion melts away
description: Labour has accused Rishi Sunak of being “in office but not in power,” after the Prime Minister saw off a rebellion over his flagship Rwanda plan.

title: Sunak Says UK Is Ready To Strike Houthis Rebels Once More
description: Rishi Sunak contradicts Grant Shapps as he warns that the UK is ready to strike Yemeni rebels once more if the group continue to hold hostages and attack shipments.

title: Rishi Sunak wins Rwanda bill vote after facing down rebels
description: The Safety of Rwanda (Asylum and Immigration) Bill passed its third reading Wednesday evening with 320 MPs voting in support, and 276 voting against, giving the government a comfortable majority of 44. Only 11 Conservative MPs voted against the bill, including former Home Secretary Suella Braverman and former immigration minister Robert Jenrick.

title: Rwanda plan: What’s next after Sunak wins vote?
description: Rishi Sunak’s flagship Rwanda plan has passed a key vote amongst MPs by 320 votes to 276. Enough MPs backed the government's key Safety of Rwanda Bill, meaning a touted rebellion by a group of Conservative MPs failed to materialise.

title: Rwanda deportation bill passes as Tory rebellion collapses
description: The Rwanda Bill has passed through the House of Commons after a Tory rebellion over the policy collapsed, in a significant victory for Prime Minister Rishi Sunak. MPs on the right of the party had sought compromises from Downing Street over the legislation, only to buckle when it came to the vote.

title: Sunak has won the immigration battle but he’s losing the election war
description: Rishi Sunak has won an important victory in the House of Commons. But he is losing the battle that really matters – for the hearts and minds of the public. It is without doubt a victory for the Prime Minister to have pushed his Safety of Rwanda Bill through the Commons, although he faces a real fight to get it through the Lords.

title: Parliament to hold a minute's silence in memory of Rochdale MP Sir Tony Lloyd
description: MPs will hold a minute's silence on Thursday (January 18) in memory of Tony Lloyd following his death aged 73. The Rochdale MP died 'peacefully' and 'surrounded' by his loved ones on Wednesday morning, his family announced.

title: Rwanda Bill passes as only 11 Tory MPs rebel
description: Brendan Clarke-Smith, who won the Red Wall seat of Bassetlaw at the last general election, left his position on Tuesday to support amendments aimed at toughening the Prime Minister’s proposals, including one that would direct British courts to ignore ECHR rulings in specific cases.

title: A red in every sense, Sir Tony Lloyd was a pillar of Greater Manchester politics - and a staunch campaigner for justice for its citizens
description: Sir Tony Lloyd, who has died aged 73, was quietly spoken, always sharply dressed and had a long political career. He was the first - albeit interim - Greater Manchester mayor in 2015, a post he held for two years. The roots of his political passion lay in the Spanish Civil War of the 1930s.

title: King Charles to attend hospital for prostate treatment
description: The King will go to hospital next week where he will be treated for an enlarged prostate. The 75-year-old monarch's condition is benign but his public engagements will be postponed while he recuperates after the corrective procedure in a few days, Buckingham Palace has announced.
